title: UK's CMA Ends Amazon and Meta Antitrust Probes After Securing Pro-Competition Commitments
originSummary: The UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has ended its antitrust investigations into Amazon and Meta after the companies made several commitments.

Amazon promised to foster fair competition in its Marketplace and improve the chances of independent sellers in the 'Buy Box', along with enabling third-party sellers to negotiate Prime delivery costs with independent couriers.

Meta pledged not to exploit user data from advertisers on its retail platform and allowed competitors to opt out of Facebook Marketplace data usage, all intended to stay in effect for the next five years.
commentSummary: The UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has concluded its antitrust investigations into Amazon and Meta, following specific pledges from these companies.

Amazon promises to safeguard fair competition in its marketplace and to give independent sellers a better position in the 'Buy Box'. Additionally, Amazon will let third-party sellers negotiate Prime delivery costs with independent couriers.

Meta, on the other hand, agreed to not misuse user data from advertisers on its retail platform. Competitors may opt out of Facebook Marketplace data usage. These commitments from both companies are set to remain for the next five years.
